item.title: Report E-2024010346
item.description:
Report E-2024010346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1760 Zep Clog Attack release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the box/pallet located on the dock due to a forklift puncture. The damaged jug and neutralizer were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard and cleanup debris were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. All good freight was re-secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010477
item.description:
Report X-2024010477

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was broken and discovered to be leaking by the manager in the unload. The manager called over QA for inspection. DescribePack: Two of the bottles were discovered to be leaking. The lids had come loose and caused them to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined bin and taken to QA to be inspected.

item.title: Report E-2024010315
item.description:
Report E-2024010315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill in Greencastle PA, due to improper loading, two 5G DM's of STARFLEX / Opaque / Red impacted the trailer floor after falling from a stack. The cans ruptured releasing approximately 1 cup of material from each bucket impacting the trailer floor. The products SDS's were reviewed with the caller and it was agreed that with proper PPE and procedures, it would be safe for the terminal to clean and containerize the spill. (1) 30G DF - STARFLEX / Red // Absorbents and (1) 30G DF - STARFLEX / Opaque // Absorbents were created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010446
item.description:
Report X-2024010446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010446 SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on the top shelf of FedEx van on its side. The driver noticed a strong odor while on the road and saw that there was a leak. DescribePack: The package was placed on the top shelf and on it's side. Two bottles started to leak. Driver called his bc and the bc met him and brought damaged package back to terminal to be processed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once found, the driver sat package right side up and called bc to bring package back to terminal. 2. X-2024010447 SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto van on the top shelf and on its side. The driver noticed a strong odor and found that the package was leaking. He then contacted his bc and his bc came to get the package off his van. DescribePack: The package was loaded on its side and 3 of the bottles started to leak. About 16-20 ounces total spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver contacted bc and the bc came and brought package back to terminal to be processed.

item.title: Report E-2024010331
item.description:
Report E-2024010331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of V410-D (UN1210) were released from one 20-ounce Ink cartridge due to improper loading by terminal XAY. The release impacted trailer #3233741. The terminal cleaned up the spill using PPE on site per the SDS. (1) 30-gallon DF contains six 20-ounce ink cartridges of V410-D and oil dri as waste and was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010343
item.description:
Report E-2024010343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of NE-101 (UN2842) occurred inside a trailer. 10 gallons spilled from a 55gal metal drum due to a forklift puncture, before it was turned on its side to stop the spill. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they advised the spill had already been cleaned; wasted product, damaged drum, spent absorbents, and used PPE had been collected in one 85-gallon metal salvage drum and left onsite for them to manage.
